item.description:
Dig Into Nature at Drumlin Farm!

Enjoy a change of pace at Drumlin Farm, we can explore a real working farm and a wildlife sanctuary all in one day. We will visit animals in the farmyard, browse the wildlife exhibits and hike to the top of the drumlin, one of the highest points in the greater Boston area.

There is a fee for admission to Drumlin if you are not an Audubon member:

$6 for nonmember adults;
$4 for nonmember children (2-12) and seniors

There is free parking, a farm stand, and gift shop.

Address:
208 South Great Road
Lincoln, MA 01773
781-259-2200
drumlinfarm@massaudubon.org

This sanctuary has the following universally accessible facilities: Nature Center, Restrooms, Audubon Shop, Farm Loop Trail.

We will meet in the parking lot.

Wear good walking shoes or boots to protect from poison ivy, rough ground cover and barnyard materials.

Afterward we can convene at Dairy Joy's road side stand for ice Cream, food, and refreshments.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be driving a black Lincoln Continental
item.name: Local Farms Part 2
